question: Question_01_(m)
sols:
The cumulative distribution function, $F(x)$, can be obtained by
integrating the probability density function from negative infinity to
$x$. i.e:

\begin{align*}F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}f(t)\,dt\end{align*} (Note that we can assume that
$f(x) = 0$ if $x > 2$ or $x < 1$). Applying the defintion of the
cumulative distribution to this problem gives:

\begin{align*}F(x) = \begin{cases} \int_{-\infty}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ 
\int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{x}2(t - 1)\,dt&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\
\int_{-\infty}^{1}0\,dt + \int_{1}^{2}2(t - 1)\,dt + \int_{2}^{x}0\,dt &\mbox{if } x > 2\\
\end{cases}\end{align*}

Simplifying gives:

\begin{align*}F(x) = \begin{cases} 0 &\mbox{if } x < 1\\ 
x^2 - 2x + 1&\mbox{if } 1 \le x \le 2\\
1 &\mbox{if } x > 2\\
\end{cases}\end{align*}
